page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The river Granta flows from the South East of our sector to the North West. To the South the land rises from the valley to over 300 feet. Trees and meadows can be found along the valley but as the land rises cereals are more common. The settlements of Gt.Abington Hildersham, and Linton lie in the valley, the name endings suggesting at least Saxon history. Abington and Hildersham are interesting, old,peace- ful and pretty villages. Linton is busier, has several large housing estates, ameneties and an industrial estate.The main road in the sector, the A604, runs along the valley with the three settlements now by-passed. The railway (now closed) follows ap- proximately the same course a little to the South. The sector is rural and intensely farmed with both arable farms and horticultural small-holdings
